title: Set up a project in SEGGER Embedded Studio
description: SEGGER Embedded Studio supports nRF Connect SDK projects. Note that you need a special version of SEGGER Embedded Studio as described in a previous step.

steps.title: Start SEGGER Embedded Studio
description: Navigate to the folder where you extracted SEGGER Embedded Studio. In the ``bin`` subfolder, run ``emStudio``.

steps.title: Open a project
steps.description: Select **File > Open nRF Connect SDK Project**

steps.title: Choose paths
steps.description: Choose the paths for the different parameters

steps.title: Zephyr Base
steps.description: **Zephyr Base**: The folder of your Zephyr repository, thus the full path to ``ncs/zephyr``.

steps.title: CMakeLists.txt
steps.description: **CMakeLists.txt**: The path to the CMakeLists.txt project file for your project, thus the full path to, for example, ``ncs/nrf/samples/bluetooth/peripheral_hids_mouse/CMakeLists.txt``.

steps.title: Build Directory
steps.description: **Build Directory**: The folder where you want the output of the build to be placed, thus the full path to, for example, ``ncs/nrf/samples/bluetooth/peripheral_hids_mouse/build``.

steps.title: Board Directory
steps.description: **Board Directory**: The folder that contains the board description of your development kit, thus the full path to, for example, ``ncs/nrf/boards/arm/nrf52840_pca20041`` or ``ncs/zephyr/boards/arm/nrf9160_pca10090``.

steps.title: GNU ARM Embedded Toolchain Directory
description: **GNU ARM Embedded Toolchain Directory**: The folder where you installed your GNU ARM Embedded Toolchain, thus, for example, *c:\gnuarmemb*

steps.title: Delete cache
steps.description: **Delete Existing CMakeCache.txt**: Select this option to ensure that you are not building with an outdated build cache.
